page.title: 06CHEBSEY - THE VICAR'S DAY
page.content: The present Vicar of Chebsey rises usually at 7.30am, and on week days says Matins at the Vicarage. After breakfast he deals with correspondence and attends meetings. In the afternoons he is mainly occupied with visiting in one of his three parishes. Sometimes he does duties in his capacity as a Prebendary at Lichfield Cathedral for which post he is entitled to wear a long black cassock with red trim and buttons. He generally says Evensong at the Vicarage. In the evenings the vicar may write a letter for the monthly Parish News, prepare candidates for confirmation or preside at a discussion group. Most Sundays he takes a service in each of his three parishes.
